alert.note: Alert for Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 1:42PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tillamook County through 215 PM PDT... At 141 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Trask, or 14 miles northeast of Pacific City, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trask. In Oregon this includes U.S. Highway 101 between mile markers 71 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; North Oregon Coast
